marker_desc: A **Major Adverse Cardiac Event (MACE)** is a heart or blood vessel related event that negatively impacts your health. Examples include heart disease, stroke, heart attack, heart failure, or other adverse coronary outcomes.
vmr_desc: Below are suggested target values for the most predictive biomarkers for experiencing MACE in males and females aged 55 to 70 with no prior history of MACE.
vmr_note: LDL and Systolic Blood Pressure are included as they are commonly looked at for MACE. However, they are not top predictive biomarkers.
rr_desc: The table below contains disease-specific risk ratios for each of the included biomarkers.

marker_desc: **Type 2 Diabetes (T2D)** occurs when the body develops a resistance to insulin, or your pancreas fails to produce enough insulin. This results in the body being unable to process and use sugar properly.
vmr_desc: Below are suggested target values for the most predictive biomarkers for developing Type 2 Diabetes in males and females aged 40 to 70.
rr_desc: The table below contains disease-specific risk ratios for each of the included biomarkers.

marker_desc: **Dementia** is an age-related condition resulting from accumulated damage to brain and nerve cells, leading to cognitive and physical decline that interferes with the ability to function in daily life.
vmr_desc: Below are suggested target values for the most predictive biomarkers for developing Dementia in males and females aged 60 to 70.
rr_desc: The table below contains disease-specific risk ratios for each of the included biomarkers.

marker_desc: **Acute Kidney Disease** occurs when the kidneys begin to lose their function.
vmr_desc: Below are suggested target values for our model’s most predictive biomarkers or inputs for developing acute kidney disease in males and females aged 55 to 70.
rr_desc: The table below contains disease-specific risk ratios for each of the included biomarkers.

marker_desc: **Liver Disease** refers to a set of conditions that prevent the proper function of the liver.
vmr_desc: Below are suggested target values for our model’s most predictive biomarkers or inputs for developing Liver Disease in males and females aged 40 to 70.
rr_desc: The table below contains disease-specific risk ratios for each of the included biomarkers.

marker_desc: **Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)** is a class of progressive lung diseases that results in difficulty breathing.
vmr_desc: Below are suggested target values for our model’s most predictive biomarkers or inputs for developing COPD in males and females aged 50 to 70.
rr_desc: The table below contains disease-specific risk ratios for each of the included biomarkers.

marker_desc: **All-Cause Mortality** refers to all forms of death due to any cause. It includes death from the other age-related issues in this guide, but is not limited to them.
